author: Eric C.

text: Just like with Brothers, I started playing this game with the keyboard (about 2 hours) and it was more frustrating than anything, knowing I couldn't fully play around with the intended gameplay mechanics. The moment I started playing with a controller, everything clicked and I just couldn't stop. I'm not even a fan of the whole luchador setting and graphics, but the gameplay and the level design are so good the rest didn't matter. The combo system with its throwing mechanic + the switching between the living and dead world + the challenging but fair platforming sections = recipe for pure fun. It's also very good at making you feel very powerful by the end of the game, something I always appreciate in a metroidvania. Great punchy soundtrack too!
author: SupraDarky

text: I thought it was going to be a bad game because of the many, many memes and pop culture references. In the end, I thought they were a nice touch. The gameplay is so tight and the soundtrack is perfect. This was probably my favorite game of 2013.
